dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: No te vi en la fiesta de anoche. ¿Por qué no fuiste?
dialog.english: I didn't see you at the party last night. Why didn't you go?

dialog.speaker: Roberto
dialog.spanish: No fui porque estaba muy cansado. Había estado trabajando todo el día.
dialog.english: I didn't go because I was very tired. I had been working all day.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué lástima! La fiesta fue muy divertida. Tú te la perdiste.
dialog.english: What a shame! The party was very fun. You missed it.

dialog.speaker: Roberto
dialog.spanish: Lo sé. Pero esta semana, voy a ir al gimnasio todos los días.
dialog.english: I know. But this week, I'm going to go to the gym every day.

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! Yo voy a ir contigo.
dialog.english: That's great! I'm going to go with you.

questions.question: ¿Por qué Roberto no fue a la fiesta?
¿Qué va a hacer Roberto esta semana?

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: ¿Recuerdas a mi amigo Lucas? Él era un estudiante de arte.
dialog.english: Do you remember my friend Lucas? He was an art student.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: Sí, lo recuerdo. Él ha sido un artista famoso ahora.
dialog.english: Yes, I remember him. He has been a famous artist now.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: La verdad es que sí. Ha sido un largo camino para él.
dialog.english: That's the truth. It has been a long road for him.

dialog.speaker: Pedro
dialog.spanish: Yo he estado en su estudio. Es muy creativo.
dialog.english: I have been to his studio. He is very creative.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Nosotros éramos muy diferentes, pero éramos buenos amigos.
dialog.english: We were very different, but we were good friends.

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Ha sido un largo camino para él'?
options: It was a long road for him
It will be a long road for him
It is a long road for him
It has been a long road for him
questions.answer: It has been a long road for him

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Yo he estado en su estudio'?
options: I have been in his studio
questions.answer: I have been in his studio

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: La reunión fue un desastre. La presentación no estaba lista.
dialog.english: The meeting was a disaster. The presentation wasn't ready.

dialog.speaker: Julia
dialog.spanish: Lo sé. Yo estaba allí. ¿Por qué no estaba lista?
dialog.english: I know. I was there. Why wasn't it ready?

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: No lo sé. Yo había ido a la oficina del jefe para avisarle, pero fue tarde.
dialog.english: I don't know. I had gone to the boss's office to warn him, but it was late.

dialog.speaker: Julia
dialog.spanish: Qué mal. El jefe estaba muy enojado.
dialog.english: How bad. The boss was very angry.

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Sí, era un problema muy grande.
dialog.english: Yes, it was a very big problem.

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Yo había ido a la oficina'?
options: I am going to the office
I had gone to the office
I have gone to the office
questions.answer: I had gone to the office

sentences.spanish: El año pasado, fui a un viaje. Era un viaje de negocios, pero me divertí mucho.
sentences.english: Last year, I went on a trip. It was a business trip, but I had a lot of fun.

sentences.spanish: Yo he estado en esa ciudad antes, así que yo era un guía para mis colegas.
sentences.english: I have been to that city before, so I was a guide for my colleagues.

sentences.spanish: Nosotros fuimos a un restaurante por la noche. La comida era deliciosa.
sentences.english: We went to a restaurant at night. The food was delicious.

sentences.spanish: Después, estábamos caminando por la ciudad. La ciudad estaba muy iluminada.
sentences.english: Afterwards, we were walking through the city. The city was very illuminated.

sentences.spanish: Fue un viaje excelente. Nosotros hemos sido buenos amigos desde entonces.
sentences.english: It was an excellent trip. We have been good friends since then.

sentences.spanish: Mi cumpleaños fue la semana pasada. Mis amigos me tenían una sorpresa.

sentences.spanish: Ellos me habían dicho que la fiesta era en casa de un amigo.
sentences.english: They had told me the party was at a friend's house.

sentences.spanish: Pero cuando llegué, todos estaban gritando '¡Sorpresa!'.
sentences.english: But when I arrived, everyone was shouting 'Surprise!'

sentences.spanish: Yo estaba muy emocionado. La comida era fantástica.

sentences.spanish: Mi mejor amiga me dijo que ella había estado planeando la fiesta por un mes.
sentences.english: My best friend told me she had been planning the party for a month.
